intro: Quercus arcaula, commonly known as the Arcaul oak, is a species of flowering plant in the beech family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America, particularly in Guatemala and Honduras. This deciduous tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and is characterized by its deeply lobed leaves and acorns. The bark is thick and fissured, providing a rugged appearance. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various forms of wildlife and contributing to forest biodiversity.
